code:
# @param {Integer[]} nums1
# @param {Integer[]} nums2
# @return {Integer}
def maximum_set_size(nums1, nums2)
    # Combine both arrays and count the occurrence of each number
    counts = Hash.new(0)
    (nums1 + nums2).each { |num| counts[num] += 1 }
    # Sort counts by the frequency of each number in descending order
    sorted_counts = counts.values.sort.reverse
    n = nums1.length
    # Calculate the number of elements to remove from each array
    remove_count = n / 2
    removed = 0
    unique_numbers = 0
    # Iterate through sorted counts to find the maximum set size
    sorted_counts.each do |count|
        # If we have removed enough elements, break
        break if removed >= remove_count
        # Calculate how many times we can remove this number from one of the arrays
        times = [count / 2, remove_count - removed].min
        # Update the count of removed elements
        removed += times
        # Update the count of unique numbers
        unique_numbers += 1
    end
    # The maximum possible size of the set is the number of unique numbers
    unique_numbers
end
